basic_info.description: My name is Jeffrey Liang. I was born in San Jose and grew up in Shanghai attending Shanghai American School. I'm a current sophmore studying Computer Science and Economics at Brown University. I'm very interested in pursuring a career in finance, specifically in investment banking, private equity, and venture capital. I'm also very involved in many computer science projects out of personal interest. I'm interested in UI/UX interface of website and mobile applications, fullstack, and machine learning specifically for prediction models. Thanks for viewing my portfolio website!

projects.title: Beya
projects.description: I am a founding member and technical project lead of Beya, a B2B app designed to empower small and medium-sized businesses with streamlined in-person selling. Beya offers features like inventory management, proximity-based vendor discovery, low-fee tap-to-pay transactions, and sales analytics. To date, we’ve supported over 20 local vendors, processed 1,000+ transactions, and hosted eight successful events at Brown University. Built with React Native and powered by Expo, Firebase, AWS, and Stripe API, Beya combines robust infrastructure with user-friendly functionality. Currently, we are in the Apple Review stage, finalizing our Tap-to-Pay Distribution Certificate. For more on Beya’s development and impact, visit our website below.

projects.title: DayGuard
projects.description: As a Project Lead Intern for DayGuard, a CPG company specializing in alcohol aid and liver protection jelly sticks, I oversee 3 critical business streams: retail expansion, campus ambassador programs, and digital growth. My role involves directly reaching out to 20+ retail stores and supporting partnership negotiations while developing comprehensive ambassador recruitment and training initiatives. I lead our social media marketing efforts to enhance brand visibility and drive sales across all channels, achieving a 20% increase in overall sales while maintaining connections with 17 college campus ambassadors and 10+ UGC/micro-influencer partnerships. A key aspect of my position is maintaining effective team communication and workflow management, which includes setting weekly priorities, coordinating schedules, and adjusting project timelines as needed. I'm also spearheading our strategic expansion to other prestigious Northeast colleges like Dartmouth and MIT, which includes creating scalable onboarding processes for new markets. This position requires a blend of strategic planning, team leadership, and hands-on execution across multiple business functions.

projects.title: Innovation Dojo
projects.description: During my freshman spring, I participated in Brown’s Innovation Dojo startup accelerator program, where my team and I developed Docferral, a startup concept designed to streamline electronic patient referrals between primary care and private practice doctors. To validate the idea, we conducted extensive interviews with physicians, securing support from leading doctors at HO’OLA, a prominent Hawaiian network of independent physicians. With guidance from mentors and case studies, we crafted a strong business value proposition, performed competitor analysis in the telehealth space, and created a minimum viable product (MVP). Additionally, we developed a revenue model and expansion strategy, culminating in a final pitch where I presented our vision to stakeholders.

projects.title: IOS App Simulation
projects.description: Smooth Tennis is a simulated app I designed to help tennis players receive real-time, personalized feedback from coaches. Unlike traditional teaching platforms, the app concept allows players to upload their videos and get tailored critiques on their techniques, eliminating the need for pre-made videos or static comparisons. I built the app's structure using Firebase for user authentication, data tracking, and media storage, ensuring seamless interactions and efficient video uploads. Using Swift and Xcode, I developed the app with an MVC structure, featuring pages for tennis posts, technique-specific views, creating posts, and tracking coach-player engagement. While the app wasn’t released, you can explore its code on my GitHub or visit my blog for detailed updates on its design and features..

projects.title: Drone Energy Optimization
projects.description: For this project, I collaborated with an STJU applied mathematics professor to address inefficiencies in delivery drones, particularly their frequent need for recharging and limited cargo capacity. Our goal was to reduce the weight of large drone wings using an elastic transportation network optimized for energy efficiency, enabling drones to carry more products over longer periods. By calculating the total elastic potential energy and gravity potential energy of the wings, we minimized the total energy to determine the optimal geometric parameters, such as the radius of internal pipelines. Using MATLAB simulations, we iteratively refined the design, aiming for a structure similar to dragonfly wings, known for their lightweight and efficient design. This work, titled Numerical Algorithm for Transportation Network, was published in the Journal of Applied Mathematics, highlighting our approach to designing significantly lighter and more efficient drone wings.

projects.title: SSD Vision Assisted Robocar
projects.description: For this project, I developed a low-cost, computationally efficient assisted driving system for navigating narrow roads with obstacles. Using a Raspberry Pi, Intel Neural Compute Stick, infrared sensors, an ultrasound sensor, and an SSD (Single Shot Detector) detection camera, I built and programmed a Raspbot Car to classify and avoid people, bikes, and vehicles. The system used OpenVINO to process video streams and adjust controls based on real-time object detection results. Testing trials confirmed the car could safely maneuver around objects or stop when necessary, achieving an average of 7.5 FPS. SSD detection proved more efficient than RCNN, Faster RCNN, or YOLO 3.0 for this setup. This project showcases the potential of cost-effective, efficient solutions for assisted driving, and I hope to continue developing custom detection models to enhance its capabilities.
